DataElement.preferredName: NCCN Distress Thermometer and Problem List for Patients Version 2.2016 Past Week Food Acquisition Problem Distress Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how distressed they have been during the past week over practical problems with food, using a yes or no indicator.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: NCCN Distress Thermometer and Problem List for Patients Version 2.2016 Past Week Food Acquisition Problem Distress
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A screening tool developed by the National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) Distress Management Panel used to identify patient distress coming from any source and patient problems in five categories._The most recent week. May include the present day._A group of substances which are consumed by humans and animals._The process by which something is acquired or obtained._A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution._A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.

ObjectClass.preferredName: NCCN Distress Thermometer and Problem List for Patients Version 2.2016
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A screening tool developed by the National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) Distress Management Panel used to identify patient distress coming from any source and patient problems in five categories.

Concepts.longName: NCCN Distress Thermometer and Problem List for Patients Version 2.2016
Concepts.definition: A screening tool developed by the National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) Distress Management Panel used to identify patient distress coming from any source and patient problems in five categories.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Food Acquisition Problem Distress
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week. May include the present day.:A group of substances which are consumed by humans and animals.:The process by which something is acquired or obtained.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.:A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A group of materials of either plant, animal or artificial origin containing essential body nutrients that can be ingested by an organism to produce energy, stimulate growth, and maintain life.
The process by which something is acquired or obtained.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.
A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk
